		Parcel Number:T14 00480004011 001 *Block:--Lot:--Subdivision:--

See report Reason for Removal:OtherComments:This mature Southern Red Oak shows multiple signs of decline. Fruiting bodies are present around the base, with an orange to reddish coloration and some dark blackish areas visible within the fissures. While probing the root collar area, I discovered a slightly hidden basal cavity and was able to insert a 3-foot rod freely, confirming an open void beneath the tree rather than within the main trunk. Sounding on the fluted area along the tension side, facing the fence, produced a hollow tone, indicating an underlying void beneath that section of the base.

singular tree in the backyard.Reason for Removal:OtherComments:Over the years, the singular tree has had various limbs fall, causing damage in and around the house. Recently, we had two large trees fall near our home, resulting in one being completely cut down and the other left by the city, causing issues in our side yard. Specifically, this tree is beginning to split at the base, and we are very concerned for our property, but most importantly, for our family inside the home. We’re fearful that the next time, it won’t be a branch that falls but the entire tree, which could cause us to lose our entire house.
